Ève Curie.label: Ève Curie
Ève Curie.description: Ève Denise Curie Labouisse was a French and American writer, journalist and pianist. Ève Curie was the youngest daughter of Marie Curie and Pierre Curie. Her sister was Irène Joliot-Curie and her brother-in-law Frédéric Joliot-Curie. Wikipedia

Émile Gaboriau.label: Émile Gaboriau
Émile Gaboriau.description: Émile Gaboriau, was a French writer, novelist, and journalist, and a pioneer of detective fiction. Wikipedia

Ömer Seyfettin.label: Ömer Seyfettin
Ömer Seyfettin.description: Ömer Seyfettin, also Omer Seyfeddin, was a Turkish nationalist writer from late 19th to early 20th century, considered to be one of the greatest modern Turkish authors. Wikipedia

Ľudo Ondrejov.label: Ľudo Ondrejov
Ľudo Ondrejov.description: Ľudo Ondrejov was a Slovak poet and prose writer. Wikipedia

Abdurrahman Sharafkandi.label: Abdurrahman Sharafkandi
Abdurrahman Sharafkandi.description:
Abdurrahman Sharafkandi or Hazhar or Hajar, was a renowned Kurdish writer, poet, linguist, and translator, from Iran.
He was also the brother of the late Kurdish politician Dr. Sadeq Sharafkandi. Wikipedia

Adam Asnyk.label: Adam Asnyk
Adam Asnyk.description: Adam Asnyk, was a Polish poet and dramatist of the Positivist era. Born in Kalisz to a noble szlachta family, he was educated to become an heir of his family's estate. Wikipedia

Adam McKay.label: Adam McKay
Adam McKay.description: Adam McKay is an American screenwriter, director, comedian, and actor. McKay has a comedy partnership with Will Ferrell, with whom he co-wrote the films Anchorman, Talladega Nights, and The Other Guys. ... Wikipedia
Awards: WGA Award for Best Comedy/Variety - (Including Talk) Series - Television

Adolf Böttger.label: Adolf Böttger
Adolf Böttger.description: Adolf Böttger was a German translator and poet. As a translator, he created German versions of works in the English language, a major project being the translation of the complete works of Byron. Wikipedia

Agrippa d'Aubigné.label: Agrippa d'Aubigné
Agrippa d'Aubigné.description: Théodore-Agrippa d'Aubigné was a French poet, soldier, propagandist and chronicler. His epic poem Les Tragiques is widely regarded as his masterpiece. Wikipedia

Ahmed Niyazi Bey.label: Ahmed Niyazi Bey
Ahmed Niyazi Bey.description: Ahmed Niyazi Bey was the Ottoman bey of the Resne area in the late 19th and early 20th centuries. An ethnic Albanian he was a member of the Young Turk Revolution. Ahmed Nyazi Bey is also known for the Saraj, a French-style estate he built in Resne. Wikipedia

Ahmet Ağaoğlu.label: Ahmet Ağaoğlu
Ahmet Ağaoğlu.description: Ahmet Ağaoğlu, also known as Ahmed bey Agayev was a prominent Azerbaijani and Turkish publicist and journalist. He was recognized as one of the founders of pan-Turkism. Wikipedia

Ai (poet).label: Ai
Ai (poet).description: Florence Anthony was an American poet and educator who legally changed her name to Ai Ogawa. She won the 1999 National Book Award for Poetry for Vice New and Selected Poems. Wikipedia
Nominations: NAACP Image Award for Outstanding Literary Work - Poetry

Aimée Sommerfelt.label: Aimée Sommerfelt
Aimée Sommerfelt.description:
Aimée Sommerfelt was a Norwegian author of numerous children's books and young adult novels.
She was most famous for her 1959 work The Road to Agra. Wikipedia

Al-Maqrizi.label: Al-Maqrizi
Al-Maqrizi.description: Taqi al-Din Abu al-Abbas Ahmad ibn 'Ali ibn 'Abd al-Qadir ibn Muhammad al-Maqrizi, was an Egyptian historian more commonly known as al-Maqrizi or Makrizi. Wikipedia

Alain Daniélou.label: Alain Daniélou
Alain Daniélou.description: Alain Daniélou was a French historian, intellectual, musicologist, Indologist, and a noted Western convert to and expert on Shaivite Hinduism. Wikipedia

Alan E. Nourse.label: Alan E. Nourse
Alan E. Nourse.description: Alan Edward Nourse was an American science fiction author and physician. He wrote both juvenile and adult science fiction, as well as nonfiction works about medicine and science. His SF works sometimes focused on medicine and/or psionics. Wikipedia
Alan E. Nourse.Born: August 11, 1928, Des Moines, Iowa, United States

Albert Alberts.label: Albert Alberts
Albert Alberts.description: Albert Alberts, writing as A. Alberts was a Dutch writer, translator, and journalist. He won numerous awards throughout his career, among them the 1975 Constantijn Huygens Prize. Wikipedia

Albert Cossery.label: Albert Cossery
Albert Cossery.description: Albert Cossery was an Egyptian-born French writer of Greek Orthodox Syrian-Lebanese descent, born in Cairo. Wikipedia

Albert Kivikas.label: Albert Kivikas
Albert Kivikas.description: Albert Kivikas was an Estonian writer and journalist. He is best known as the author of the book "Names in Marble", the subject of which is the Estonian War of Independence. Wikipedia

Alberto Vázquez-Figueroa.label: Alberto Vázquez-Figueroa
Alberto Vázquez-Figueroa.description: Alberto Vázquez-Figueroa is a Spanish novelist. His novels have sold over 25 million copies worldwide. Wikipedia
Alberto Vázquez-Figueroa.Born: November 11, 1936 (age 77), Santa Cruz de Tenerife, Spain

Alejo Carpentier.label: Alejo Carpentier
Alejo Carpentier.description: Alejo Carpentier y Valmont was a Cuban novelist, essayist, and musicologist who greatly influenced Latin American literature during its famous "boom" period. Wikipedia

Aleksa Šantić.label: Aleksa Šantić
Aleksa Šantić.description: Aleksa Šantić was a Bosnian Serb poet. He was the editor-in-chief of the review Zora. Wikipedia

Alex Haley.label: Alex Haley
Alex Haley.description: Alexander Murray Palmer "Alex" Haley was an American writer. He is best known as the author of the 1976 book Roots The Saga of an American Family and as the co-author of The Autobiography of Malcolm X. Wikipedia
Alex Haley.Born: August 11, 1921, Ithaca, New York, United States
Books: Roots The Saga of an American Family
Queen The Story of an American Family
Selected from a Different Kind of Christmas
Roots The Enhanced Edition The Saga of an American Family

Alexios Schandermani.label: Alexios Schandermani
Alexios Schandermani.description: Alexios Schandermani is an Iranian writer. Wikipedia

Alfred Wainwright.label: Alfred Wainwright
Alfred Wainwright.description: Alfred Wainwright MBE was a British fellwalker, guidebook author and illustrator. His seven-volume Pictorial Guide to the Lakeland Fells, published between 1955 and 1966 and consisting entirely of ... Wikipedia

Aline Valangin.label: Aline Valangin
Aline Valangin.description: Aline Valangin was a Swiss writer, pianist, and psychoanalyst. In Zurich she was follower of Carl Jung and became a psychoanalyst. Wikipedia

Allan Cole.label: Allan Cole
Allan Cole.description:
Allan Cole is an American author and television writer, who has written or co-written nearly thirty books.
The son of a CIA operative, Cole was born in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, and raised in Europe, the Middle East and the Far East. Wikipedia
Nominations: Locus Award for Best Fantasy Novel

Allen Carr.label: Allen Carr
Allen Carr.description: Allen Carr was a British author of books about quitting smoking and other psychological dependencies including alcohol addiction. He quit smoking after 33 years as a hundred-a-day chain smoker. Wikipedia

Alyson Noël.label: Alyson Noel
Alyson Noël.description: Alyson Noël is an American author from Orange County, California. Wikipedia

Amalie Skram.label: Amalie Skram
Amalie Skram.description: Amalie Skram was a Norwegian author and feminist who gave voice to a woman's point of view with her naturalist writing. She moved to Denmark in 1894 where she settled in Copenhagen with her husband, the Danish writer Erik Skram. Wikipedia

Amanda Filipacchi.label: Amanda Filipacchi
Amanda Filipacchi.description: Amanda Filipacchi is an American novelist. She was born in Paris and educated in both France and the U.S. She is the author of three novels, Nude Men, Vapor, and Love Creeps. Wikipedia

Ameen Rihani.label: Amin al-Rihani
Ameen Rihani.description: Ameen Rihani, was a Lebanese Arab-American writer, intellectual and political activist. He was also a major figure in the mahjar literary movement developed by Arab emigrants in North America, and an early theorist of Arab nationalism. Wikipedia
Books: The Book of Khalid - Illustrated by Khalil Gibran
The White Way and the DesertMore

Amiri Baraka.label: Amiri Baraka
Amiri Baraka.description: Amiri Baraka, formerly known as LeRoi Jones and Imamu Amear Baraka, was an American writer of poetry, drama, fiction, essays and music criticism. Wikipedia
Amiri Baraka.Born: October 7, 1934, Newark, New Jersey, United States
Amiri Baraka.Died: January 9, 2014, Newark, New Jersey, United States

Amitav Ghosh.label: Amitav Ghosh
Amitav Ghosh.description: Amitav Ghosh, is a Bengali Indian author best known for his work in English fiction. Wikipedia
Nominations: Locus Award for Best Science Fiction Novel

Amy Hempel.label: Amy Hempel
Amy Hempel.description: Amy Hempel is an American short story writer, journalist, and teaches creative writing at Bennington College and at Harvard University. Wikipedia
Awards: Rea Award for the Short Story
New York Times 10 Best Books of the Year

Amy Lowell.label: Amy Lowell
Amy Lowell.description: Amy Lawrence Lowell was an American poet of the imagist school from Brookline, Massachusetts, who posthumously won the Pulitzer Prize for Poetry in 1926. Wikipedia

Amy Richards.label: Amy Richards
Amy Richards.description: Amy Richards is an United States activist, writer, organizer, feminist and art historian. She graduated from Barnard College in 1992. Richards has appeared in Fox’s The O'Reilly Factor, Oprah, Talk of the Nation, New York One and on CNN. Wikipedia

Anatoly Rybakov.label: Anatoly Rybakov
Anatoly Rybakov.description: Anatoly Naumovich Rybakov was a Soviet and Russian writer, the author of the anti-Stalinist Children of the Arbat tetralogy, novel Heavy Sand, and many popular children books including Adventures of Krosh, Dirk, Bronze Bird, etc. Wikipedia
Anatoly Rybakov.Died: December 23, 1998, New York City, New York, United States

Andon Zako Çajupi.label: Andon Zako Çajupi
Andon Zako Çajupi.description: Andon Zako Çajupi was a leading Albanian rilindas, poet, and playwright writer that actively participated in the Albanian National Awakening. Wikipedia

Andrei Voznesensky.label: Andrei Voznesensky
Andrei Voznesensky.description: Andrei Andreyevich Voznesensky was a Soviet and Russian poet and writer who had been referred to by Robert Lowell as "one of the greatest living poets in any language." Wikipedia
Awards: Common Wealth Award of Distinguished Service

Andrew Davidson (author).label: Andrew Davidson
Andrew Davidson (author).description: Andrew Davidson is a Canadian novelist. He has a B.A. in English literature from the University of British Columbia, and worked as a teacher in Japan before returning to Canada. Wikipedia

Andrus Kivirähk.label: Andrus Kivirähk
Andrus Kivirähk.description:
Andrus Kivirähk is an Estonian writer.
By 2004, 25,000 copies of his book Rehepapp ehk November had been sold, making him the most popular 21st century Estonian writer. Wikipedia

Andrzej Szczypiorski.label: Andrzej Szczypiorski
Andrzej Szczypiorski.description: Andrzej Szczypiorski was a Polish novelist and politician; member of the Polish legislature, Solidarity activist interned during the military crackdown of 1981. He was a secret police agent in the 1950s. Wikipedia

Andy McDermott.label: Andy McDermott
Andy McDermott.description: Andy McDermott is a British thriller author, and former journalist, magazine editor and film critic. McDermott is best known for his Nina Wilde and Eddie Chase novels. Wikipedia

Angela Steinmüller.label: Angela Steinmüller
Angela Steinmüller.description: Angela Steinmüller is a German mathematician and science fiction author. Together with her husband Karlheinz Steinmüller she has written science fiction short stories and novels that depict human ... Wikipedia

Angelos Sikelianos.label: Angelos Sikelianos
Angelos Sikelianos.description: Angelos Sikelianos was a Greek lyric poet and playwright. He wrote on national history, religious symbolism, and universal harmony in poems such as The Light-Shadowed, Prologue to Life, Mother of God, and Delphic Utterance. Wikipedia

Angie Sage.label: Angie Sage
Angie Sage.description: Angie Sage is the author of the Septimus Heap series which includes Magyk, Flyte, Physik, Queste, Syren, Darke and Fyre. She is also the illustrator and/or writer of many children's books, and is the new writer of the Araminta Spook series. Wikipedia

Anita Augspurg.label: Anita Augspurg
Anita Augspurg.description: Anita Augspurg was a German lawyer, actor, writer and feminist. Wikipedia

Anita Brookner.label: Anita Brookner
Anita Brookner.description: Anita Brookner CBE is a Booker award-winning novelist and art historian. Wikipedia

Ann C. Crispin.label: Ann Carol Crispin
Ann C. Crispin.description: Ann Carol Crispin was an American science fiction writer, the author of twenty-three published novels. Her writing career began in 1983. She wrote several Star Trek novels, and created her own original science fiction series called Starbridge. Wikipedia

Ann Radcliffe.label: Ann Radcliffe
Ann Radcliffe.description: Ann Radcliffe was an English author and a pioneer of the Gothic novel. Her style is romantic in its vivid descriptions of landscapes and long travel scenes, yet the Gothic element is obvious through her use of the supernatural. Wikipedia

Anne Fine.label: Anne Fine
Anne Fine.description: Anne Fine, OBE FRSL is a British writer, best known for children's books although she also writes for adults. She is a Fellow of the Royal Society of Literature and she was awarded an OBE in 2003. Wikipedia

Anne Holt.label: Anne Holt
Anne Holt.description: Anne Holt is a Norwegian author and lawyer. Wikipedia

Anne Weber.label: Anne Weber
Anne Weber.description: Anne Weber is a German-French author, translator and self-translator. Since 1983 Anne Weber lives in Paris. She studied in Paris and worked for several editors. Wikipedia

Annie Dillard.label: Annie Dillard
Annie Dillard.description: Annie Dillard is an American author, best known for her narrative prose in both fiction and non-fiction. She has published works of poetry, essays, prose, and literary criticism, as well as two novels and one memoir. Wikipedia

Annette von Droste-Hülshoff.label: Annette von Droste-Hülshoff
Annette von Droste-Hülshoff.description: Anna Elisabeth Franziska Adolphine Wilhelmine Louise Maria, Freiin von Droste zu Hülshoff, known as Annette von Droste-Hülshoff, was a 19th-century German writer and composer. Wikipedia
Parents: Clemens August von Droste zu Hülshoff

Antal Csengery.label: Antal Csengery
Antal Csengery.description: Antal Csengery, Hungarian publicist, and a historical writer of great influence on his time, was born at Nagyvárad. Wikipedia

Anton Pann.label: Anton Pann
Anton Pann.description: Anton Pann, was an Ottoman-born Wallachian composer, musicologist, and Romanian-language poet, also noted for his activities as a printer, translator, and schoolteacher. Wikipedia

Antonio Porta (author).label: Antonio Porta
Antonio Porta (author).description: Antonio Porta was an author and poet and one of the founders of the Italian literary movement Gruppo 63. Wikipedia

Arnaldur Indriðason.label: Arnaldur Indriðason
Arnaldur Indriðason.description: Arnaldur Indriðason is an Icelandic writer of crime fiction; most of his books feature the protagonist Detective Erlendur. Wikipedia
Awards: Grand Prix de Littérature Policière - International Category

Arnold Stadler.label: Arnold Stadler
Arnold Stadler.description: Arnold Stadler is a German writer, essayist and translator. He was born April 9, 1954 in Meßkirch in the district of Sigmaringen in Baden-Württemberg in Germany. Wikipedia

Arnolt Bronnen.label: Arnolt Bronnen
Arnolt Bronnen.description: Arnolt Bronnen was an Austrian playwright and director. Wikipedia

Arnon Grunberg.label: Arnon Grünberg
Arnon Grunberg.description: Arnon Yasha Yves Grunberg is a Dutch writer. Some of his books were written using the heteronym Marek van der Jagt. Wikipedia

Atanas Dalchev.label: Atanas Dalchev
Atanas Dalchev.description: Atanas Hristov Dalchev was a Bulgarian poet, critic and translator. He is an author of poetry that brightly touches some philosophical problems. He translated poetry and fiction from French, Spanish, English, German and Russian authors. Wikipedia

Attilâ İlhan.label: Attila İlhan
Attilâ İlhan.description: Attilâ İlhan was a Turkish poet, novelist, essayist, journalist and reviewer. Wikipedia

Attila József.label: Attila József
Attila József.description: Attila József was a Hungarian poet of the 20th century. Wikipedia

Augusten Burroughs.label: Augusten Burroughs
Augusten Burroughs.description: Augusten Xon Burroughs is an American writer known for his New York Times bestselling memoir Running with Scissors. Wikipedia

Aurelio González Ovies.label: Aurelio González Ovies
Aurelio González Ovies.description: Aurelio González Ovies is a Spanish writer and poet from Asturias. He has a Ph.D in Classical Philology and he is a teacher of Latin at the University of Oviedo, where he served as vice dean of the Faculty of Philology from 1996 to 2008. Wikipedia

Baldur Ragnarsson.label: Baldur Ragnarsson
Baldur Ragnarsson.description: Baldur Ragnarsson is an Icelandic poet and author of Esperanto works. He was a teacher and a superintendent of schools in Iceland. Wikipedia

Barbara Cartland.label: Barbara Cartland
Barbara Cartland.description: Dame Mary Barbara Hamilton Cartland, DBE, CStJ, was an English author, one of the most prolific and commercially successful authors of the 20th century. Wikipedia

Barbara Mertz.label: Barbara Mertz
Barbara Mertz.description: Barbara Mertz was an American author who wrote under her own name as well as under the pseudonyms Elizabeth Peters and Barbara Michaels. Wikipedia
Awards: Malice Domestic Award for Lifetime Achievement

Barbara Guest.label: Barbara Guest
Barbara Guest.description: Barbara Guest née Barbara Ann Pinson was an American poet and prose stylist. Guest first gained recognition as a member of the first generation New York School of poetry. Wikipedia
Barbara Guest.Born: September 6, 1920, Wilmington, North Carolina, United States

Barbara Neely.label: Barbara Neely
Barbara Neely.description: Barbara Neely is an African-American novelist, short story writer and activist who writes murder mysteries. Her first novel, Blanche on the Lam, introduced the protagonist Blanche White, a middle-aged mother, domestic worker and amateur detective. Wikipedia
Awards: Anthony Award for Best First Novel
Agatha Award for Best First Novel
Macavity Awards for Best First Mystery Novel

Bari Wood.label: Bari Wood
Bari Wood.description: Bari Wood is an American author of science fiction, crime and horror novels. Wikipedia

Barry Hughart.label: Barry Hughart
Barry Hughart.description: Barry Hughart, is an American author of fantasy novels. Wikipedia
Nominations: Locus Award for Best Fantasy Novel

Barrington J. Bayley.label: Barrington J. Bayley
Barrington J. Bayley.description:
Barrington J. Bayley was an English science fiction writer.
Bayley was born in Birmingham and educated in Newport, Shropshire. Wikipedia

Barry Took.label: Barry Took
Barry Took.description: Barry Took was an English writer, television presenter and comedian. A decade long writing partnership with Marty Feldman led to the television series Bootsie and Snudge and the radio comedy Round the Horne and other projects. Wikipedia
Books: Comedy Greats A Celebration of Comic Genius Past and Present
Awards: British Academy Television Award for Best Writer

Bell hooks.label: Bell Hooks
Bell hooks.description: Gloria Jean Watkins, better known by her pen name bell hooks, is an American author, feminist, and social activist. She took her nom de plume from her maternal great-grandmother Bell Blair Hooks. Wikipedia
Movies: Happy to Be Nappy and Other Stories of Me
Nominations: NAACP Image Award for Outstanding Literary Work

Bengt Pohjanen.label: Bengt Pohjanen
Bengt Pohjanen.description: Bengt Erik Benedictus Pohjanen, born 26 June 1944 in Kassa in Pajala, Norrbotten, Sweden, is a Swedish author, translator and priest living in Haparanda. Wikipedia

Ben Schott.label: Ben Schott
Ben Schott.description: Ben Schott is a British writer, photographer, and author of the Schott's Miscellanies and Schott's Almanac series. Wikipedia

Benjamin Zephaniah.label: Benjamin Zephaniah
Benjamin Zephaniah.description: Benjamin Obadiah Iqbal Zephaniah is an English writer, dub poet and Rastafarian. He was included in The Times list of Britain's top 50 post-war writers in 2008. Wikipedia
Benjamin Zephaniah.Born: April 15, 1958 (age 55), Handsworth, West Midlands, United Kingdom
Movies: Bob Marley & Other Reggae Stars Reggae's Got Soul

Beppo Levi.label: Beppo Levi
Beppo Levi.description: Beppo Levi was an Italian mathematician. He published high-level academic articles and books, not only on mathematics, but also on physics, history, philosophy, and pedagogy. Wikipedia

Bernard Cornwell.label: Bernard Cornwell
Bernard Cornwell.description: Bernard Cornwell, OBE is an English author of historical novels. He is best known for his novels about Napoleonic Wars rifleman Richard Sharpe which were adapted into a series of Sharpe television films. Wikipedia

Bernard le Bovier de Fontenelle.label: Bernard le Bovier de Fontenelle
Bernard le Bovier de Fontenelle.description: Bernard Le Bovier de Fontenelle, also called Bernard Le Bouyer de Fontenelle, was a French author. Isaiah Berlin said Fontenelle "was the most civilized man of his time, and indeed of most times." Wikipedia
Books: Conversations on the Plurality of Worlds

Bernhard Hennen.label: Bernhard Hennen
Bernhard Hennen.description: Bernhard Hennen is a German writer of fantasy literature. He is married and lives in Krefeld. He began his writing career with Das Jahr des Greifen which he co-authored with Wolfgang Hohlbein in 1993–1994. Wikipedia

Beryl Markham.label: Beryl Markham
Beryl Markham.description: Beryl Markham was a British-born Kenyan author, aviator, adventurer, and racehorse trainer. During the pioneer days of aviation, she became the first woman to fly solo across the Atlantic from east to west. Wikipedia

Binyavanga Wainaina.label: Binyavanga Wainaina
Binyavanga Wainaina.description: Binyavanga Wainaina is a Kenyan author, journalist and winner of the Caine Prize for African Writing. Wikipedia
Awards: The Caine Prize for African Writing

Blake Nelson.label: Blake Nelson
Blake Nelson.description: Blake Nelson is an American author of adult and children's literature. He grew up in Portland, Oregon, and attended Wesleyan University and New York University. Wikipedia

Brendan Behan.label: Brendan Behan
Brendan Behan.description: Brendan Francis Behan was an Irish poet, short story writer, novelist, and playwright who wrote in both English and Irish. He was also an Irish republican and a volunteer in the Irish Republican Army. Wikipedia

Bliss Carman.label: Bliss Carman
Bliss Carman.description: Bliss Carman FRSC was a Canadian poet who lived most of his life in the United States, where he achieved international fame. He was acclaimed as Canada's poet laureate during his later years. Wikipedia
Bliss Carman.Died: June 8, 1929, New Canaan, Connecticut, United States

Brian Cherney.label: Brian Cherney
Brian Cherney.description:
Brian Cherney is a Canadian composer currently residing in Montreal, Quebec.
Cherney was born in Peterborough, Ontario. He studied at the University of Toronto where he was a pupil of John Weinzweig, Samuel Dolin, and John Beckwith. Wikipedia
Nominations: Juno Award for Classical Composition of the Year

Brian Herbert.label: Brian Herbert
Brian Herbert.description:
Brian Patrick Herbert is an American author who lives in Washington state. He is the elder son of science fiction author Frank Herbert.
Brian Herbert's novels include Sidney's Comet, Prisoners of Arionn, Man of Two Worlds, and Sudanna Sudanna. Wikipedia

Brian Moore (novelist).label: Brian Moore
Brian Moore (novelist).description: Brian Moore was a novelist and screenwriter from Northern Ireland who emigrated to Canada and later lived in the United States. Wikipedia
Movies: The Lonely Passion of Judith Hearne
